menus

Class MenuFrames

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • menus.MenuFrames
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class MenuFrames
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The "MenuFrames" class, which creates a JFrame window to which JPanel objects and other components (i.e. JButton, JMenuBar, JMenu, JMenuItem...) are added. The window acts as the program's main menu, and based on the user's interactions with it, the appropriate action will occur (opening a dialog box, changing the current panel, opening the game screen, etc.).
    Version:
    1.0, May 12 2014. (No functionality. Buttons do not appear.), 1.1, May 13 2014. (Completed framework. ActionListener only implemented to close, main menu, and play.), 1.2, May 14 2014. (Added background image. Resized frame and specs.), 1.3, May 15 2014. (Changed some variable and method names, fixed layout, added padding between buttons and initial JavaDoc notations.), 1.4, May 19 2014. (Added background music.), 1.5, May 20 2014. (Changed background and button graphics.), 1.6, May 21 2014. (Added window listener, key bindings and dialog boxes.), 2.0, May 22 2014. (Reorganized code: split panels into separate classes, listeners given separate methods.), 2.1, May 24 2014. (Added instructions panel, replaced boolean secondPanel with int panelNum, made corrections to some comments.), 2.2, May 25 2014. (Added settings panel and option to start/stop music.), 2.3, May 26 2014. (Fixed glitches with music.), 2.4, May 27 2014. (Difficulty buttons now go to separate windows.), 2.5, May 29 2014. (Replaced features menu item with instructions menu item.), 2.6, May 30 2014. (Fixed: settings --> main --> play --> main --> settings --> null pointer exception. Rearranged some code and added 4 new methods.), 2.7, June 4 2014. (Removed setSettings method because of redundency, changed access level of settings, added code for highscores [should be functional].), 2.8, June 4 2014. (All components of this class are complete. Need to do final testing.), 2.9, June 8 2014. (Added actionlisteners to all menu buttons of each panel.)
    Author:
    Chusa Nguyen, Anqi Wu
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MenuFrames

        public MenuFrames()
        The constructor of the "MenuFrames" class. It creates the JFrame by calling the constructor of this class's super class. It sets an image as the background, sets the menu bar along with its options, as well as sets the main menu's panel by calling the appropriate methods.

    • Method Detail

      • settings

        public void settings()
        The "settings" method. It adds an instance of SettingsPanel to the frame, and creates a new instance if one has yet to have been created. It also initializes the AudioClip object from the SettingsPanel class upon first instantiation.

      • getMenuFrame

        public MenuFrames getMenuFrame()
        The "getMenuFrame" method, which returns a MenuFrames object.
        Returns:
        Returns this instance of MenuFrames.

      • removeSettings

        public void removeSettings()
        The "removeSettings" method, which allows other classes to remove the settings panel.

      • getSettings

        public SettingsPanel getSettings()
        The "getSettings" method, which returns an instance of SettingsPanel.
        Returns:
        Returns the current instance of SettingsPanel by calling its accessor method.
